title: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine: Park Home
body: O! say can you see,...  by the dawn's early light, a large red, white and blue banner? Whose broad stripes and bright stars . . . were so gallantly streaming! over the star-shaped Fort McHenry during the Battle of Baltimore, September 13-14, 1814. The valiant defense of the fort inspired Francis Scott Key to write "The Star-Spangled Banner."              Ranger Talks   Join a ranger for a Flag Change, Flag Talk, Ranger Talk
